Activity

Sort the problem according to which part of the network they can be associated with, IR, RF or Bluetooth.

Check IR, RF or Bluetooth for each problem.
1. <textformat blockindent='13'>Zoe checks her e-mail at the airport.</textformat>
2. <textformat blockindent='13'>Sheldon wears his earpiece so he can talk hands-free on his cell phone.</textformat>
3. <textformat blockindent='13'>Georges and Cleo sit side by side at the park playing Internet chess on their PDAs.</textformat>
4. <textformat blockindent='13'>Suzanne’s CD player is upstairs in her bedroom. She wears her cordless headphones so she can listen to music 3 floors down in the basement.</textformat>
5. <textformat blockindent='13'>Frederik buys 3 new wireless devices to attach to his desktop computer at home.</textformat>
6. <textformat blockindent='13'>Dominic changes the channel on his TV with a remote.</textformat>
7. <textformat blockindent='13'>Helen’s new cordless phone uses the 5.8 GHz range.</textformat>
Congratulations! You have selected all of the technologies that apply. Click Next to continue.
Remember that Bluetooth is similar to RF but at lower power. Also IR is older technology that has effectively been replaced by Bluetooth. IR is line of sight and one to one connectivity.
